sentences.sContent: They had to struggle against all kinds of adversity.
sentences.sCn: 他们不得不同各种困境斗争。

sentences.sContent: ...Women struggle to say no in the workplace for similar reasons...
...A reasonable assumption—don’t families struggle to avoid nursing homes and suffer real guilt if they can’t...
...Where once retirement was seen as a brief reward after a long struggle through some miserable job...
...that’s the number of Americans who struggle with hanger To make tomorrow a little better...
...People who struggle with excessive Internet use maybe depressed or have other mood disorders...
...For small regional colleges that struggle just to fill seats...

trans.tranOther: to try extremely hard to achieve something, even though it is very difficult
